content: cameron another pattern from wandering cat studio cameron is an easy unisex fingerless mitt pattern that is great for hands of all sizes because of the stretchy rib it will be the perfect fit for the daintiest of lady fingers right up to giant man hands 1 materials ▪ approximately 150 yards of fingering weight yarn ▪ set of 2 5 mm dpns ▪ two stitch markers ▪ stitch holder or spare piece of yarn ▪ darning needle abbreviations ▪ k = knit ▪ p = purl ▪ kfb = knit in the front then the back of the stitch ▪ pfkb = purl in the front knit in the back of the stitch ▪ kfbf = knit in the front then the back of the stitch then the front of the stitch again ▪ pm = place marker ▪ sm = slip marker pattern starting at the cuff cast on 60 stitches join in the round being careful not to twist first round k1 p2 k2 repeat stitches in brackets until last stitch k1 work in rib pattern as set until cuff measures 3 5 inches or desired length next round begin thumb gusset work in pattern for 29 stitches pkfb work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern for 30 stitches pm k1 pm work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern to marker sm kfbf sm work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern to marker sm k3 sm work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern to marker sm kfb kfb k1 sm work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern to marker sm k5 sm work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern to marker sm kfb k3 kfb k1 sm work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern to marker sm k7 sm work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern to marker sm kfb k5 kfb k1 sm work in pattern for remaining stitches next round work in pattern to marker sm k9 sm work in pattern for remaining stitches 2 continue increasing in this manner until you have 19 stitches between the markers next round work in pattern to first marker remove marker place 21 thumb gusset stitches on a stitch holder or spare piece of yarn work in pattern until end of round next round work in pattern as set continue working in pattern until hand from thumb opening measures 2 5 inches or desired length cast off of loosely begin thumb pick up 1 stitch from opening just before thumb stitches place 21 thumb stitches on needles arranging as comfortable pick up two more stuches from opening just after thumb stitches knit one row joining in the round next round k1 p2 k2 repeat stitches in bracket until last stitch k1 repeat round 7 more times cast off loosely weave in and secure ends make second
